subject: Fashion
title: Wholesale vs Direct-to-Consumer
description: A micro-lesson that makes Wholesale vs Direct-to-Consumer usable.

hook.text: A $100 shirt sold wholesale earns $50. Sold direct? Up to $85.

buildup.text: Wholesale means selling to retailers who mark up and resell to you.

discovery.text: Direct-to-consumer cuts the middlemanâ€”brands sell straight to shoppers online.

twist.text: But DTC brands must fund their own marketing, shipping, and returns.

climax.text: Most successful brands now blend both channels for margin and reach.

punchline.text: Higher margins mean nothing without customers.

quiz.question: Why do DTC brands earn higher margins?
